dct_title_s: Sable Antelope Sites on the Eastern Coast of Kenya, 1998
dct_description_sm: This dataset portrays locations of sable antelope sites on the eastern coast of Kenya. Included are locations such as the Shimba Hills Reserve (about 15â€“20 kilometers inland from the coast) a site famous for its sable antelope, the last remaining breeding population of these animals in the country
This data was used in Map 6.4 and Map 6.5 in Nature's Benefits in Kenya: An Atlas of Ecosystems and Human Well-Being.

Data set is not for use in litigation. This layer is presented in the WGS84 coordinate system for web display purposes. Downloadable data are provided in native coordinate system or projection.
